page.title: 15 GREAT SUTTON WATERWORKS
page.content: When{water supplies}for Capenhurst were needed Sutton Hall Water Works was built. It covers 23 acres of land but employs only 20 people. The water is obtained from the{river Dee}and is treated by activated{carbon and {chlorine}which is added to kill germs. A holding tank containing 5.5 million litres of water is present in case the {Dee pumping station}breaks down. It takes 20 hours for water from the Dee to reach our taps, almost of the Wirral is supplied from here. It pumps out 120 million litres of treated water every day to over 500,000 people. The works stores 50 tons of chlorine in two large tanks. If any escaped it could cause a{disaster. Gorsthills School situated next to the works has a safety drill-just in case!
